title: Red Sea Max Nano G2 XXL Aquarium
content: Red Sea Max Nano G2 XXL Aquarium The all-new MAX NANO G2 XXL comes with all the necessary equipment needed for a stunning home reef, sparing you from component selection or compatibility. It benefits from superior infrastructure, optimal water management, extra-fortified cabinets, and 2 new G2 features: ReefATO+ and NanoMat-ready rear sumps. Reef safe ReefLED 50 Lighting The MAX NANO G2 XXL incorporates the all-new Red Sea ReefLED 50 lights which are designed to ensure optimal coral growth and maximum rendition of their vibrant colors. At the heart of the unit is a compact Led array that provides a reef-safe range of REEF-SPEC light through a single REEF-SPEC Blue (23,000 Kelvin) channel that consists of an optimum combination of ultraviolet, violet and blue LEDs and an 8,000 Kelvin white channel. In addition, it has a separate dedicated 3W Moonlight channel to provide the low levels of light for reef-safe nighttime viewing. The ReefLED includes a single optical-glass, hollow lens that creates a homogeneous light giving a dramatic coral coloration and a gentle shimmer throughout the aquarium. ReefLED is controlled by Red Sea's ReefBeat App which provides a wide range of easy to use functions such as random clouds, acclimation for new installations and a lunar cycle for the moonlights. The LED unit is firmly bolted to the aquarium and can be rotated to give easy access to the rear sump for all of regular maintenance requirements or for reefscaping. MAX NANO G2 XXL Ultra-Clear Glass The front and two side panels of the MAX NANO are constructed from 8mm ultra-clear glass with smart beveled edges top and bottom for the ultimate viewing experience. MAX NANO G2 XXL Circulation Two European Eco pump provides a total of 3600 l/h (409gph each) of water flow, circulating the entire water volume 18 times an hour through the filter system. Flow is returned to the aquarium via the discrete multi-directional "eye ball" nozzles that can be adjusted to ensure there are no dead spots within the aquarium, preventing harmful detritus from building up on the corals. MAX NANO G2 XXL Rear Sump The complete filtration system is hidden in the rear sump that is topped by a rotatable screen for easy access. Fed by a unique surface skimmer that directs the water to a bespoke micron filter bag, the rear sump houses a silenced REEF- SPEC protein skimmer, two 1550lph /409gph European ECO circulation pumps. MAX NANO G2 XXL Protein Skimmer The heart of the filtration system is the protein skimmer. The NANO XL skimmer implements Red Sea's REEF-SPEC criteria for SPS corals, passing the entire volume of the aquarium water through the skimmer approximately 3 times per hour and with a 3 to 1 water to air ratio. The NANO XL skimmer is not affected by the regular fluctuation in the water level of the rear sump due to evaporation and has an adjustable outlet gate to maintain the optimal skimmate consistency which will vary according to actual water conditions. The NANO XL skimmer runs quietly with a built-in silencer on the air intake and a sponge on the outlet to eliminate the sound of cascading water. Rotatable Rear Sump Screen The rotatable screen allows easy access to the rear filtration compartment sump, while ensuring that the aquarium's aesthetics are undisturbed. NanoMat-ready The NanoMat provides you with enhanced mechanical filtration, thanks to an auto-advance fleece-roll mechanism that keeps your tank water crystal clear. * Optional add-on, purchased separately. ReefATO+ ready The ReefATO+ provides you with an extremely reliable auto top-off system and a highly accurate temperature monitor and leak detector. *Optional add-on, purchased separately. Red Sea Max Nano G2 XXL Dimensions and Specifications Total System Water Volume: 200 Litres (52.8 Gallons) Display Tank Water Volume: 168.5 Litres (44.3 Gallons) Rear Sump Water Volume: 31.5 Litres (8.3 Gallons) Tank Length/Width/Height (excluding light): 90cm x 55cm x 50cm (35.4" x 21.65" x 19.7") Total System Height: 137cm / 53.9" (with stand) Front Glass Thickness: 12mm Side Glass Thickness: 12mm Bottom Glass Thickness: 12mm 2 - 1550LPH pumps included with 1 outlet and built-in surface skimmer with removable combs. Stand NOT included Shipping Notes To avoid delays please order Red Sea aquariums by themselves. If you are wishing to order multiple things, please place two separate orders. One for the aquarium, and one for the rest of your products. Please call for a shipping quote if ordering from NWT, YK, or NUN. All Red Sea aquariums are brought in and shipped out on an as ordered basis. The average turn-around time to ship an aquarium to you is two business days except as where noted below. All shipments outside of the Vancouver Area are shipped via trucking company with residential and power tailgate delivery, and are fully insured. Tanks ordered within BC and (in some circumstances) Alberta may take an extra 5-10 business days to process. Systems ordered from Alberta and east of there usually will ship within two business days direct from the distributor in Ontario. If you are ordering for pick-up from our store, please select in-store pickup to avoid delivery charges. You will be notified when the tank arrives (usually within 5-10 business days). Red Sea Max S Series aquariums are always special order and will take from 3-6 weeks to ship. Please note the freight company is only responsible for getting the aquarium to the destination address and off-loading it. They are not responsible for carrying it inside. All freight charges have been greatly subsidized to help you get up and running with your new Red Sea system!

title: A
content: About Us A-2-Sea Solutions Ltd is a global telecommunications cable shore end and shallow water installation organisation. For nearly 20 years, A-2-Sea has been providing expert cable engineering, jointing, shallow water system installation and cable maintenance services to the global subsea community, including design and development of specialised cable joints and Power Grounding Units. A-2-Sea Solutions Ltd provide marine survey services to the offshore renewable, subsea cable, dredging and aggregates, coastal engineering and utilities industries. The latest state-of-the-art survey equipment and purpose-built survey vessels are utilised for the provision of high resolution hydrographic and geophysical products. A specialist survey team offer a wealth of experience in nearshore surveys including pre-and-post construction offshore wind farm developments, turbine inspection and monitoring, cable monitoring, nautical charting, pipeline detection, hazard identification (UXO), environmental baseline and benthic sampling. A-2-Sea Solutions Ltd are UVDB Achilles registered and are certified with ISO:9001 (Quality Management) and ISO:14001 (Environment).

title: Project Management

Job Description Creating and improving Shopee Mall&aposs internal standard operating procedures Establish processes to collect and analyse internal and external market data to derive business insights Develop data-backed business strategies and support the business teams in executing the strategies Establish processes and identify appropriate indicators to monitor performance and progress Formulate and facilitate project missions, goals and resource management Draw up project plans and communicate effectively across multiple involved internal and external stakeholders to align on scope, timelines and expectations Requirements Bachelors degree in any field is required Experience in e-commerce, consulting, fast-paced tech start-ups, private equity, or investment banking are advantageous Proficient in Microsoft Excel skills and a number-oriented person Strong logical thinking and problem-solving skills Passionate and portrait strong interest in joining the e-commerce industry Good team player, positive attitude and eager to learn Show more Show less More Info Industry:Other Function:E-Commerce Job Type:Permanent Job Skills Required Microsoft Excel

title: Pioneering A New Twist On Coworking Models
content: Pioneering A New Twist On Coworking Models Vietnamese fintech startup Finhay has raised a $25 million Series B round led by Singapore-based Openspace Ventures, an early backer of Indonesia‚Äôs GoTo Group and 30 Under 30 Asia honoree Rexy Josh Dorado‚Äôs Manila-based social media site Kumu, and private firm Vietnam Investments Group. Other investors in the round included Singapore-based Insignia Ventures Partners, TVS, Headline,TNB Aura and IVC, Finhay said in a statement. Earlier this month, Insignia, whose other investments include GoTo and Singapore-based used-car unicorn Carro, led a pre-Series A funding round for Bluesheets, a financial data startup in Singapore. The funds will be used to invest in business expansion, talent acquisition and technology develop- ment. Finhay also bought a securities brokerage, making it the only licensed digital investment platform in Vietnam, according to the startup. Finhay was founded in 2017 by Huy Nghiem, a Vietnamese-Australian who quit his finance job in Australia. The startup operates a micro-investment platform for Millennials and has more than 2.7 million registered users in the country of almost 100 million people. It recommends multiple micro-financial products including saving, investment and insurance based on the customer‚Äôs personal information and risk assessment. The customers can then start building their wealth through Finhay with as little as $3. Nghiem, who made the 30 Under 30 Asia list in 2020, envisions Finhay as a one-stop solution where customers can manage their wealth seamlessly. ‚ÄúFinhay is already emerging as the clear frontrunner in Vietnam‚Äôs booming investment space,‚Äù Jessica Huang Pouleur, partner at Openspace, said in the statement. ‚ÄúWe believe a massive opportunity exists in Vietnam, which has an enterprising population hungry for the chance to invest smartly.‚Äù The Vietnamese economy has grown since 2012, posting 6% growth or higher every year through 2019 on the strength of export manufacturing and the spending power of its population. Growth fell to 2.9% in pandemic year 2020 and 2.6% last year. ‚ÄúA large number of people are now looking for ways to start investing ‚Äì often for the first time, and we are exploring different ways to enable them,‚Äù added Nghiem. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs such an important inflection point.‚Äù Other rising fintech platforms in Vietnam include MoMo, which has raised money from the likes of Goldman Sachs, Warburg Pincus and Vietnam Investments Group, and Toss, the fintech superapp operated by South Korean billionaire Lee Seung-gun‚Äôs Viva Republica.

title: Grab Driver scolded me 'Self
content: Upon reaching the destination, I expressed my disappointment to the grab driver in his service; the grab driver retorted me, saying he followed strictly to the drop off point indicated in grab & scolded me for being self-entitled. Luckily i had my umbrella so I use it to shelter myself from the rain as I left the car. To note that this sheltered carpark is not available as drop off point in grab, but is within 100m close to my original drop off point. Question The question is am I considered being self- entitled for requesting grab driver to drop me off at nearby area that is very close to original drop off point to avoid the rain? Click to expand... If he doesn't drop u off at the drop off point, Grab will buah him le... 100m is quite a distance away on the map.

title: Assistant Manager, Merchant Data Analytics & Improvement
content: Get to Know the Team We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Operations Solution Specialist to become a part of our Merchant Operations team. You have a solid background in audit, payments, and data governance. You will demand a proactive individual that can build and document efficient processes, as well as using SQL skills to effectively extract and manage data. Get to Know the Role As the Assistant Manager for Merchant Payments & Governance, you will help support Grab's business activities within the realms of data and payments. You will encompass a variety of responsibilities, including financial reconciliation, discrepancy resolution, data governance, and process optimization. You will be reporting to the Manager, Merchant Core Operations, and based in Petaling Jaya, working onsite. The Critical Tasks You Will Perform You will need to continuously monitor and assess the merchant payment and collection processes. Identify opportunities for improvement and implement solutions to ensure accurate payments and seamless transaction processing. You will utilize a variety of tools and dashboards to ensure seamless integration between merchant entry points and Grab systems. Focus on maintaining data accuracy and delivering a positive experience for merchants. You will need to suggest and develop automated processes wherever possible to enhance operational efficiency and streamline workflows.

title: Willkie
content: Tiffany, a partner in the firm‚Äôs Corporate & Financial Services Department, is one of the leading advisers on technology transactions in California. She counsels clients on a wide range of intellectual property issues across various industries, including life sciences, healthcare, electronics, semiconductor, and media and entertainment. Tiffany serves on the IP Committee of the Asian Pacific American Bar Association of Silicon Valley and previously served on the 2020-21 Commission on Judicial Nominees Evaluation (JNE) for the State of California, which assists the Governor in the judicial selection process. How Race, Age and Gender Shape Attitudes Towards Mental Health How Race, Age and Gender Shape Attitudes Towards Mental Health ThinkNow Mental health has been in the news quite a bit lately. Dozens of U.S. states are currently suing Meta for contributing to the youth mental health crisis by inserting addictive features into their products, while the U.S. Surgeon General is touring the nation to bring awareness to the growing epidemic of loneliness and isolation. The country has endured periods of low national morale, such as in the 1970s when high inflation and the energy crisis worsened public sentiment following the Vietnam War. The current mood, however, feels different. Gallup recently reported that national mental health is at an all-time low, with few bright spots to lift spirits. To better understand how Americans are feeling and their attitudes towards mental health in general, ThinkNow conducted a nationally representative quantitative survey of 1,500 respondents and found some interesting differences among ethnic, age and gender groups. Technology For example, 52% agree that technology and social media have a negative impact on mental health, but when broken out by race, 61% of Whites felt technology had a negative effect, and only 48% of Hispanics thought it did. While technology has helped us keep in touch with friends and family in faraway places, it appears to have degraded our ability to connect in person. Staying connected online is a double-edged sword since the same news feed that brings us pictures of the grandkids and fluffy kittens also feeds us news about the wars in Israel and Ukraine, the dysfunction in Washington, the latest mass shooting and the climate crisis. Hispanics may have a built-in defense against the isolation technology breeds, owing to their large, multigenerational households, strong social support systems, and tendency to use social media to stay connected with relatives abroad. Age and Gender When asked how individuals rate their mental health, men rate it higher than women by 11 percentage points, and Baby Boomers rank it highest at 83%, saying it‚Äôs good or excellent vs. 57% of Gen Z saying the same. Gen Z spends the most amount of time on social media, so the notion that social media negatively affects mental health appears to be correlated. Unfortunately, Gen Z is also the generation that‚Äôs least comfortable discussing mental health concerns with healthcare professionals. Only 40% of them state they‚Äôre comfortable discussing their issues with a professional compared to 60% of Millennials and 65% of Boomers. Race Affects Attitudes As seen in previous research conducted by ThinkNow, Asian Americans lag other groups when it comes to awareness of mental health issues. Twenty-four percent of Asian Americans believe that having a mental health issue is a sign of weakness compared to the 16% average for all groups. Asians are also considerably less likely to be aware of mental health services in their communities (42% vs. 55%) and most likely to seek out information on social media (51% vs. 35%). Google's Just Not That Into You: Understanding Core Updates & Search Intent Google's Just Not That Into You: Understanding Core Updates & Search Intent Lily Ray 1. Core updates from Google periodically change how its algorithms assess and rank websites and pages. This can impact rankings through shifts in user intent, site quality issues being caught up to, world events influencing queries, and overhauls to search like the E-A-T framework. 2. There are many possible user intents beyond just transactional, navigational and informational. Identifying intent shifts is important during core updates. Sites may need to optimize for new intents through different content types and sections. 3. Responding effectively to core updates requires analyzing "before and after" data to understand changes, identifying new intents or page types, and ensuring content matches appropriate intents across video, images, knowledge graphs and more. title: Green Moves takes out double win
content: What a night! We are beyond thrilled to have taken home both the Transparency Award AND the People‚Äôs Choice Award at the Sustainability Tracker Impact Awards. And huge congratulations to all the finalists and winners of the 2024 Impact Awards! We know its from 2024, but we only just found out last week. The incredible work being done across industries is inspiring, and we‚Äôre honoured to be among such changemakers as Adorn Cosmetics, Toucan eco, Underwear for Humanity, Tempur, Unicharm, Dilmah Tea, Volvo Group, Energy Locals, ComfortDelGro Australia, Farm to Hanger, Pablo & Rusty‚Äôs Coffee Roasters, John West, Koh, Frank Wild, Europcar and Globird energy The Transparency Award Winning the Transparency Award against some large organisations is a testament to our unwavering commitment to honesty, accountability, and real climate action. Its us walking the talk and holding ourselves accountable to the same high standards we provide for our clients. Small businesses often struggle to keep motivated, and awards like this really help to keep enthusiasm up and energy pumping. It confirms that small businesses can have an impact, lets keep it going. Want to see what we‚Äôve done and get some ideas for your own business? Head over to our profile on the Sustainability Tracker website here, all our actions are there. Want to know more? Just ask us, we‚Äôre always happy to share. The People‚Äôs Choice Award And the People‚Äôs Choice Award? That one means the world to us because it wasn‚Äôt judged by judges, it was judged by votes from you‚Äîour clients, our community, our supporters, and those who believe in what we do. A huge heartfelt thank you to you all. This means more than we can say and confirms to us that providing a great customer service is key. Sustainability takes a team and a movement Sustainability isn‚Äôt a solo effort and we have a fantastic team behind us for which we are very grateful, couldn‚Äôt do it without you! Sustainability is a collective movement, and we‚Äôre proud to be surrounded by clients and a community that shares our vision for a better future. A huge thank you to our team and everyone who voted, works with us, and champions our mission. Winning the Transparency Award and People‚Äôs Choice Award was incredible, but the Sustainability Tracker Impact Awards was about so much more than trophies (and highly sustainable trophies at that). We connected with some of the most forward-thinking sustainability leaders, exchanged ideas, and celebrated the collective progress we‚Äôre making toward a better, more accountable future. We heard some powerful speeches to inspiring stories, and not a boring bit insight on the night!. The evening reinforced why we do what we do. Real impact starts from action ‚Äî and we‚Äôre so proud to be a part of a movement leading the way. If you‚Äôd like to talk to us about how we can assist you or your business, or have any queries just contact us ‚Äì we‚Äôre always happy to help.

title: Senior Architect
content: City of Ryde, just 12 kilometres from Sydney CBD, is a place of unique lifestyle and opportunity. It is home to a culturally diverse community of around 130,000 people, and a strong and growing Smart City economy including more than 13,000 local businesses, Macquarie Park, world-class hospitals, and a leading university. All balanced with beautiful bushland, riverfront parks, open spaces, and sport facilities. Our council delivers a broad range of services, projects, programs, and events. We are actively committed to innovation, sustainability, resilience and providing exceptional customer experiences, and this relies on attracting and keeping great people. We offer a range of benefits, including flexible work arrangements, health and wellbeing programs, a learning and development program including study support, and a reward and recognition program. About the Role Join the City Architect‚Äôs Office and play a key role in shaping the architectural and urban design future of our community. As a senior architect, you will lead architectural projects, provide strategic design advice, and oversee the development of high-quality public spaces and council assets. Working closely with internal and external stakeholders, you‚Äôll contribute to design excellence, support professional growth within the team, and shape a more sustainable, inclusive, and vibrant city. About You We are looking for a registered architect with experience leading architectural projects in design-led teams. This role requires project management skills, the ability to mentor teams, and a collaborative approach to achieving successful outcomes. Your skills in architectural design, problem-solving, and working with stakeholders will help shape the future of the City of Ryde‚Äôs built environment. In addition, you will also have:

Riley‚Äôs sold-out show was a benefit for the LA wildfire and hurricane relief efforts of the Nashville Chapter of the Recording Academy, which hands out Grammy Awards. It was the first time the Alabama native had performed at the iconic venue.
